metadata.title: CVE-2018-3837 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable information disclosure vulnerability exists in the PCX imagerendering functionality of Simple DirectMedia Layer SDL2_image-2.0.2. Aspecially crafted PCX image can cause an out-of-bounds read on the heap,resulting in information disclosure . An attacker can display a speciallycrafted image to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3837` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.1+dfsg-2+deb9u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-5+deb9u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl2-image package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.1+dfsg-2+deb9u1build0.16.04.1').
sdl-image1.2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-5+deb9u1build0.16.04.1').
